headline: Trevor Noah Bashes Biden, Dems, Media and GOP: Here's Everything He Said
author: Scott McDonald
sentences: He also ridiculed CNN, Chris Cuomo, MSNBC, Florida Governor Ron DeSantis, Texas Governor Greg Abbott, Republicans in general, newsmaking Democrats in general and, well, pretty much everyone he could within an allotted time frame.

"Mr. President thank you for being here, thank you for having me here and I was a little confused about why me, then I was told that you get your highest approval ratings when a bi-racial African guy is standing next to you.

I might add you know he got a bipartisan infrastructure bill passed that we do everything from fixing America's road and bridges to modernizing school buses which Matt Gaetz his girlfriend is very excited about."
Noah said he was "nervous" about hosting such an event after the Oscars, in which Will Smith didn't like a joke from Chris Rock, and then Smith stormed the stage to slap Rock across the face.
But you know moving to MSNBC is going to be a big switch up for you because right now your current job is to make Biden Administration look as good as possible, you know, at all costs.
Noah jokingly said to the wine-imbibing crowd that if they needed a ride home, they could reach Abbott, who recently sent illegal immigrants from Texas to Washington, D.C. on a bus.
The annual White House Correspondents Association dinner met for the first time since 2019 on Saturday night, and the first time with a sitting president since Barack Obama in 2016.
Biden acknowledged he was about to get roasted before not just the 2,600 in attendance in the Washington hotel ballroom, but before millions watching on cable.
"What those people don't understand is that you guys have integrity, you would never allow personal connections to affect your ability to be good journalists.

Biden said free speech against the president in America wouldn't get the comedian jailed like "they do in Russia."
The comedian's jokes quickly shifted back to GOP governor's Greg Abbott of Texas and Ron DeSantis of Florida.
White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki wasn't spared either as she was ridiculed for catching COVID-19 again.
Noah then suggested that first lady Dr. Jill Biden had voted for Bernie Sanders during the last election.
Noah went on to thank the politicians, journalists, celebrities, award winners and others in attendance.
